intro: Phragmorchis teretifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf phragmorchis, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its root system is fibrous, and it often grows in wet or marshy environments. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine, though its botanical applications are not extensively documented.
